result.execSummary:
The defendant William A Wisth was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, William A Wisth was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. William A Wisth is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • William A Wisth was found guilty of Contempt of Court/Disobey Order, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 785.01(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Found Not Guilty at Jury Trial

charges.dispoDesc: Found Not Guilty at Jury Trial

supervisions.notes: Court costs to be paid within 120 days. Failure to pay may result in a civil judgment being entered.

Defendant is granted privileges set forth in Wis Stats 303.08. Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the descretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

9/28/2015 Court grants motion for stay of jail term pending appeal. Def released on $2500 signature bond.  Case set for status hearing regarding the appeal on 1/7/2016 at 2:00 pm.

(kad - clerk)
State appears by Ozaukee County District Attorney Adam Gerol. Attorney Trisha Stewart Martin for defendant, William Wisth, who appears in person. 
Matter before the court for an oral ruling on defendant's post-conviction motion to set aside jury verdict. Court withdraws stayed warrant and bail forfeiture. Oral response by counsel. Court renders oral ruling and denies defendant's motion for post-conviction relief. Court withdraws previous order granting bail pending appeal, denies motion to vacate the judgment of conviction and directs sentence to commence forthwith. Defense requests bail be granted pending appeal; no objection from the State. Court grants bail pending appeal. Matter adjourned until 10-5-2016 at 1:15 p.m. for status.
(Court of Appeals) Motion to Enlarge Appeal Deadlines
Oral ruling on July 1, 2016 at 09:00 am.

State by DA Adam Gerol.  Atty Trisha Martin for defendant, William Wisth.  Matter set for motion-Post-Conviction to set aside jury verdict.  Court orders case passed to allow counsel time to reach the defendant.  Case recalled; same appearances.  Atty Martin moves to enlarge time to request an extension from the Court of Appeals and adjourn matter to allow defendant time to appear and to reply.  No objection by the State.  Court grants motion to enlarge time.  Court orders matter adj to 7/1 at 9 am.  Court issues a capias and bail forfeiture, but stays until 7/1/16.

Question of jury

5/26/2015 Trial   Exhibit 1 - Cardboard sign, Exhibit 3 - Lg paper drawing located in Exhibit Room S 2-5,
  Exhibit 4 DVD located in CD/DVD binder

Defendant William A Wisth in court with attorney Mike Kenitz.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court and counsel discussion. Court recess. 

  8:59  am   Jurors reported and given oath. 
  9:00  am   20 jurors called to jury box.
  9:05  am   Voir dire by Court.
  9:10  am   Voir dire by Atty. Gerol.
  9:29  am   Voir dire by Atty. Kenitz.
  9:38  am   Striking by counsel. 
  9:41  am   12 jurors called to hear case.
  9:42  am   Court excuses balance of jurors. 
  9:44  am   Jury sworn.
  9:45  am   Court/jury recess.
10:02  am   Court in session. Court/counsel in discussion.
10:06  am   Court preliminary instructions given to jury.
10:10  am   Opening statement by Atty. Gerol. 
10:16  am   Opening statement by Atty. Kenitz.
10:25  am   M.B. sworn and testified. Exam by Atty. Gerol, crossexam by Atty. Kenitz.
10:37  am   C. M. sworn and testified. Exam by Atty. Gerol, crossexam by Atty. Kenitz. 
10:48  am   Jury excused due to objection. 
10:52  am   Jury in court. Testimony of C. M. continues with crossexam by Atty. Kenitz, redirect.
10:58  am   Jury excused for clarification.
11:04  am   Jury in court. Testimony of C. M. continues with redirect by Atty. Gerol.
11:08  am   Officer Gary Keller sworn and testified. Exam by Atty. Gerol, crossexam by Atty. Kenitz.
11:20  am   State rests. 
11:20  am   Jury excused. Defense motion to dismiss. Court denies motion.
11:22  am   Court recess.
11:40  am   Jury in court. Video played for jury (Exhibit #4)
11:55  am   Jury excused. Lunch recess to 1:15 pm. 
11:56  am   Court questions defendant as to his right to testify.
11:58  am   Lunch recess.
  1:22  pm   William Wisth sworn and testified. Exam by Atty. Kenitz.
  1:28  pm   Jury excused due to objection.
  1:32  pm   Jury in Court. William Wisth resumes testimony with exam by Atty. Kenitz, crossexam by Atty. Gerol, redirect. Defense rests.
  2:17  pm   Rebuttal testimony. Deputy Richard Helm sworn and testified. Exam by Atty. Gerol, crossexam by Atty. Kenitz, redirect. 
  2:38  pm   Court/jury recess.
  2:44  pm   Court/jury in court. Court instructs jury.
  2:55  pm   Closing statement by Atty. Gerol.
  3:08  pm   Closing statement by Atty. Kenitz.
  3:20  pm   Rebuttal statement by Atty. Gerol. 
  3:29 pm   Court further instructs jury.
  3:31 pm   Bailiff sworn.
  3:32 pm   Jury leaves for deliberation.
  4:28 pm   Court is informed jury has a question. Court/counsel in court and discuss answer to question.
  4:29 pm   Jury in court. Court responds to jury question.
  4:31 pm   Jury leaves for deliberation.
  5:08 pm   Court/counsel in court. Jury not present. Court allows #2 exhibit to go to jury. 
  5:35 pm   Court is informed verdict has been reached.
  5:42 pm   Court/counsel/jury in Court. Verdict read:  Ct. 1 - Not Guilty    Ct. 2 - Guilty
  5:45 pm   Jury polled, thanked and excused.
  5:46 pm   State moves for judgment on the verdict. Court grants motion. Atty. Kenitz requests another date for further proceedings.
                    Defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict-denied. 
*Court adjourns 14CF220 for sentencing and 14CF233 for further proceedings. Clerk will contact Judge Martens clerk to schedule a date in Washington County.
